intro: Fragmosa uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower fragmosa, is a flowering plant characterized by its unique floral structure. It typically features a single, showy flower that blooms during the spring or early summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. It is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often considered an endangered species.
